title: Meet the retired oil exec plugging forgotten wells to reduce emissions

multiple-choice.question: **Knowledge**: What is the estimated number of orphan oil and gas wells across America?

options.label: B
options.text: 1 million

options.label: C
options.text: 2 million

options.label: D
options.text: 5 million

multiple-choice.question: **Comprehension**: What is the main reason why orphan wells are a problem, according to Curtis Shuck?

options.label: A
options.text: They are a threat to national security

options.label: B
options.text: They are a source of environmental pollution

options.label: C
options.text: They are a financial burden on the government

options.label: D
options.text: They are a threat to public health

multiple-choice.question: **Application**: If you were to adopt an orphan well, what steps would you take to plug it, according to Curtis Shuck?

options.label: A
options.text: Hire a team of experts to drill a new well

options.label: B
options.text: Use the same gear to plug the well as you would to drill it

options.label: C
options.text: Fill the well with sand and trash

options.label: D
options.text: Leave it alone and let nature take its course

multiple-choice.question: **Analysis**: How do earthquakes affect plugged wells, according to Ira Leafer?

options.label: A
options.text: They cause the wells to leak more

options.label: B
options.text: They make it easier to plug the wells

options.label: C
options.text: They can reopen plugged wells

options.label: D
options.text: They have no effect on plugged wells

multiple-choice.question: **Synthesis**: What is one potential solution to the problem of orphan wells, according to Ira Leafer?

options.label: A
options.text: Get the government to take over the responsibility of plugging wells

options.label: B
options.text: Get the oil and gas industry to front more of the bill

options.label: C
options.text: Use renewable energy to replace oil and gas

options.label: D
options.text: Leave the problem to the states

multiple-choice.question: **Evaluation**: What is the significance of the Regrow Act, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a new law that bans the use of oil and gas

options.label: B
options.text: It is a law that requires oil and gas companies to pay for plugging wells

options.label: C
options.text: It is a law that allocates $4.7 billion for well pluggings

options.label: D
options.text: It is a law that has no impact on the problem of orphan wells

multiple-choice.question: **Knowledge**: What is the name of the company that measures air pollution to hunt down the biggest leaks, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Bubbleology

options.label: B
options.text: Well Done Foundation

options.label: C
options.text: Regrow Act

options.label: D
options.text: Ira Leafer's company

multiple-choice.question: **Comprehension**: What is the main goal of the Well Done Foundation, according to Curtis Shuck?

options.label: A
options.text: To drill new wells

options.label: B
options.text: To plug orphan wells

options.label: C
options.text: To measure air pollution

options.label: D
options.text: To educate people about the problem of orphan wells

multiple-choice.question: **Application**: If you were to use air monitoring instruments to detect leaks, what would you look for, according to Ira Leafer?

options.label: A
options.text: Elevated levels of methane

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased levels of methane

options.label: C
options.text: No change in methane levels

options.label: D
options.text: No effect on methane levels

multiple-choice.question: **Evaluation**: What is the significance of the fact that the Regrow Act will only address documented wells, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It means that the problem of orphan wells is solved

options.label: B
options.text: It means that the government is taking a proactive approach to addressing the problem

options.label: C
options.text: It means that the problem of orphan wells is more complex than initially thought

options.label: D
options.text: It means that the government is not doing enough to address the problem
